11#ifndef API_VIDEO_CODECS_VIDEO_CODEC_H_
12#define API_VIDEO_CODECS_VIDEO_CODEC_H_
13
14#include <stddef.h>
15#include <stdint.h>
16
17#include <string>
18
19#include "absl/strings/string_view.h"
20#include "absl/types/optional.h"
21#include "api/video/video_bitrate_allocation.h"
22#include "api/video/video_codec_type.h"
23#include "api/video_codecs/spatial_layer.h"
24#include "rtc_base/system/rtc_export.h"
25
26namespace webrtc {
27
28// The VideoCodec class represents an old defacto-apis, which we're migrating
29// away from slowly.
30
31// Video codec
32enum class VideoCodecComplexity {
33 kComplexityNormal = 0,
34 kComplexityHigh = 1,
35 kComplexityHigher = 2,
36 kComplexityMax = 3
37};
38
39// VP8 specific
40struct VideoCodecVP8 {
41 bool operator==(const VideoCodecVP8& other) const;
42 bool operator!=(const VideoCodecVP8& other) const {
43 return !(*this == other);
44 }
45 VideoCodecComplexity complexity;
46 unsigned char numberOfTemporalLayers;
47 bool denoisingOn;
48 bool automaticResizeOn;
49 bool frameDroppingOn;
50 int keyFrameInterval;
51};
52
53enum class InterLayerPredMode : int {
54 kOff = 0, // Inter-layer prediction is disabled.
55 kOn = 1, // Inter-layer prediction is enabled.
56 kOnKeyPic = 2 // Inter-layer prediction is enabled but limited to key frames.
57};
58
59// VP9 specific.
60struct VideoCodecVP9 {
61 bool operator==(const VideoCodecVP9& other) const;
62 bool operator!=(const VideoCodecVP9& other) const {
63 return !(*this == other);
64 }
65 VideoCodecComplexity complexity;
66 unsigned char numberOfTemporalLayers;
67 bool denoisingOn;
68 bool frameDroppingOn;
69 int keyFrameInterval;
70 bool adaptiveQpMode;
71 bool automaticResizeOn;
72 unsigned char numberOfSpatialLayers;
73 bool flexibleMode;
74 InterLayerPredMode interLayerPred;
75};
76
77// H264 specific.
78struct VideoCodecH264 {
79 bool operator==(const VideoCodecH264& other) const;
80 bool operator!=(const VideoCodecH264& other) const {
81 return !(*this == other);
82 }
83 bool frameDroppingOn;
84 int keyFrameInterval;
85 uint8_t numberOfTemporalLayers;
86};
87
88// Translates from name of codec to codec type and vice versa.
89RTC_EXPORT const char* CodecTypeToPayloadString(VideoCodecType type);
90RTC_EXPORT VideoCodecType PayloadStringToCodecType(const std::string& name);
91
92union VideoCodecUnion {
93 VideoCodecVP8 VP8;
94 VideoCodecVP9 VP9;
95 VideoCodecH264 H264;
96};
97
98enum class VideoCodecMode { kRealtimeVideo, kScreensharing };
99
100// Common video codec properties
101class RTC_EXPORT VideoCodec {
102 public:
103 VideoCodec();
104
105 // Scalability mode as described in
106 // https://www.w3.org/TR/webrtc-svc/#scalabilitymodes*
107 // or value 'NONE' to indicate no scalability.
108 absl::string_view ScalabilityMode() const { return scalability_mode_; }
109 void SetScalabilityMode(absl::string_view scalability_mode) {
110 scalability_mode_ = std::string(scalability_mode);
111 }
112
113 // Public variables. TODO(hta): Make them private with accessors.
114 VideoCodecType codecType;
115
116 // TODO(nisse): Change to int, for consistency.
117 uint16_t width;
118 uint16_t height;
119
120 unsigned int startBitrate; // kilobits/sec.
121 unsigned int maxBitrate; // kilobits/sec.
122 unsigned int minBitrate; // kilobits/sec.
123
124 uint32_t maxFramerate;
125
126 // This enables/disables encoding and sending when there aren't multiple
127 // simulcast streams,by allocating 0 bitrate if inactive.
128 bool active;
129
130 unsigned int qpMax;
131 unsigned char numberOfSimulcastStreams;
132 SpatialLayer simulcastStream[kMaxSimulcastStreams];
133 SpatialLayer spatialLayers[kMaxSpatialLayers];
134
135 VideoCodecMode mode;
136 bool expect_encode_from_texture;
137
138 // The size of pool which is used to store video frame buffers inside decoder.
139 // If value isn't present some codec-default value will be used.
140 // If value is present and decoder doesn't have buffer pool the
141 // value will be ignored.
142 absl::optional<int> buffer_pool_size;
143
144 // Timing frames configuration. There is delay of delay_ms between two
145 // consequent timing frames, excluding outliers. Frame is always made a
146 // timing frame if it's at least outlier_ratio in percent of "ideal" average
147 // frame given bitrate and framerate, i.e. if it's bigger than
148 // |outlier_ratio / 100.0 * bitrate_bps / fps| in bits. This way, timing
149 // frames will not be sent too often usually. Yet large frames will always
150 // have timing information for debug purposes because they are more likely to
151 // cause extra delays.
152 struct TimingFrameTriggerThresholds {
153 int64_t delay_ms;
154 uint16_t outlier_ratio_percent;
155 } timing_frame_thresholds;
156
157 // Legacy Google conference mode flag for simulcast screenshare
158 bool legacy_conference_mode;
159
160 bool operator==(const VideoCodec& other) const = delete;
161 bool operator!=(const VideoCodec& other) const = delete;
162
163 // Accessors for codec specific information.
164 // There is a const version of each that returns a reference,
165 // and a non-const version that returns a pointer, in order
166 // to allow modification of the parameters.
167 VideoCodecVP8* VP8();
168 const VideoCodecVP8& VP8() const;
169 VideoCodecVP9* VP9();
170 const VideoCodecVP9& VP9() const;
171 VideoCodecH264* H264();
172 const VideoCodecH264& H264() const;
173
174 private:
175 // TODO(hta): Consider replacing the union with a pointer type.
176 // This will allow removing the VideoCodec* types from this file.
177 VideoCodecUnion codec_specific_;
178 std::string scalability_mode_;
179};
180
181} // namespace webrtc
182#endif // API_VIDEO_CODECS_VIDEO_CODEC_H_
183
